message.content: Let $T$ represent the value of $T$, $E$ represent the value of $E$, and so on. Then $T+E+A+M=35$. Similarly, $T+E+A+M=38$, so we have $M-A=3$. Also, $T+E+A+M=42$ so $A-M=4$. This system of equations yields $A=7$ and $M=4$; the value of $A$ is $\boxed{7}$. Alternatively, note that $M-A=3$ or $A=M-3$. This gives $A=7.$
